Website content divides part A and B , will host in Server A and Server B separately.

The question is, how the website address link to the thing in serve B...?
method 1: server A set up a direct path ( www.xxx.com/partB ) link to server B IP address..... that's forwarding and masking??

method 2: from server B ppl told...we need to set up a sub.domain (partB.xxx.com) then link to server B .... but this way i need to create a sub-domain, so i need to register or pay for this sub-domain name?

method 3: iframe server B content into the main website by changing main website's coding...

May i know which way is the best way???

-------------------------------
And i super confuse too....
some people said "partB.xxx.com" should be treated as a new domain, not a sub-domain..... is this correct...

(i can read chinese,,,, but hard to describe in chinese only...)

Surely no iframe bro.
iframe is considered dangerous in terms of web security.

I am not sure of your current configuration. But I assume that server A got the URL of www.serverA.com while server B got the URL www.serverB.com

Method 1 requires you to host content A & B on the same server, unless you added the HTTP Redirection directive in the httpd.conf. For instance, "Redirect /partB www.serverB.com"


And for Method 2, if you own your DNS server, you can set up as many as sub-domain you want. If you don't, please check if your current web hosting plan permit you to set up the sub-domains.

Correct me if I am wrong Chings.
